summary: This is an email or memo from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated December 19, 2018, summarizing a phone call with an attorney representing multiple victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The AUSA informs the attorney that an investigation into Epstein has been opened and seeks information about other individuals to interview, while requesting confidentiality due to the covert nature of the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document states an investigation has been opened into Jeffrey Epstein because the contacted attorney represents multiple victims/plaintiffs against him.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: The attorney contacted by the AUSA, who represents multiple victims/plaintiffs in the Epstein case. He provides information about other attorneys and potential misconduct.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Identified by Bradley Edwards as a primary attorney on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Identified by Bradley Edwards as another primary attorney on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Identified by Bradley Edwards as an attorney who may also work on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Former U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Sigrid McCawley has worked with. The context implies potential discussion of misconduct related to his prior handling of the Epstein case.

connections.description: Edwards represents multiple victims/plaintiffs in cases against Jeffrey Epstein.
Edwards identifies Goldberger as a primary attorney on the Epstein case, suggesting collaboration or shared knowledge.
Edwards identifies Cassell as a primary attorney on the Epstein case, suggesting collaboration or shared knowledge.
Edwards advises that McCawley has worked with former U.S. Attorney Acosta.
The AUSA contacts Edwards to gather information for the covert Epstein investigation and requests confidentiality.

events.title: AUSA Call with Victim Attorney
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney calls attorney Bradley Edwards to inform him that an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein has been opened and to seek information about other individuals to interview.

events.title: Opening of SDNY Epstein Investigation
events.description: The document references that an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein has been opened by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York opened a covert investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of December 2018.
The investigation was discussed with victim attorney Bradley Edwards, who represents multiple plaintiffs against Epstein.
The AUSA sought information about other attorneys (Jack Goldberger, Paul Cassell, Sigrid McCawley) and potential witnesses to interview.
The AUSA raised concerns about possible obstruction of justice or perjury in connection with civil suits against Epstein.
The AUSA specifically requested confidentiality for the investigation to avoid raising victims' hopes prematurely and to maintain its covert nature.
